part.para: If S,T\from V\to W are linear maps, so is (S+T)\from V\to W, defined by (S+T)(\Vect{x}):= S(\Vect{x}) + T(\Vect{x})
If t is in \RNr and L\from V\to W is linear, then so is (tL)\from V\to W, defined by (tL)(\Vect{x}) := t\cdot (L(\Vect{x})).
If S\from U\to V and T\from V\to W are linear maps, so is the composite (T\Comp S)\from U\to W, defined by T\Comp S(\Vect{u}):= T(S(\Vect{u})).

proof.para: These statements may be proved directly from the definition. The details are left as a exercises.
